name: The Gadget
description: The Gadget is the codename for the first atomic bomb ever detonated.

content.title: Overview
content.body: **The Gadget** was the first nuclear device ever detonated as part of the Manhattan Project, marking a pivotal moment in military and scientific history. Its primary purpose was to demonstrate the viability of a nuclear weapon.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The Gadget was a spherical device, with a shell of explosively formed lenses designed to compress a plutonium core, leading to a nuclear explosion. Its exterior had a metallic, industrial appearance with numerous wires and components protruding.

content.title: Function
content.body: The Gadget utilized an implosion-type nuclear weapon design. High explosives formed around a plutonium core were detonated to compress it into a supercritical state, initiating a nuclear chain reaction and a resultant explosion.

content.title: History
content.body: Developed during the Manhattan Project, The Gadget was the culmination of scientific efforts led by physicists such as J. Robert Oppenheimer. It was assembled and tested by a team of scientists and engineers at the Los Alamos Laboratory and detonated at the Trinity Test Site on July 16, 1945.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The detonation of The Gadget in 'Oppenheimer' symbolizes the birth of the atomic age and the consequential ethical and moral dilemmas faced by scientists and humanity. Its test is a climactic moment that influences the narrative arc and the personal and professional life of J. Robert Oppenheimer.
